program.title: Generative & Agentic AI Engineering — 1 Year Live Workshop Series
program.tagline: Build, deploy, and master AI systems in 12 months — from foundations to enterprise-ready agentic systems.
duration: Live weekly sessions + self-paced labs + capstone
Live Zoom sessions every Saturday and Sunday (8–10 am)
outcomes: Design and build grounded Generative AI systems (RAG)
Create single-agent and multi-agent workflows that call tools and maintain memory
Finetune and adapt models for domain needs using PEFT/LoRA
Deploy and operate LLM-based systems with observability, guardrails and cost controls
Build no-code AI flows and integrate with business apps
Deliver an enterprise-grade capstone system and portfolio case study

courses.title: AI Essentials for Everyone
courses.description: High level overview of Generative AI, practical exposure to chat models and no-code flows.
lessons: Introduction to Generative AI (LLMs, LMMs, Diffusion)
Core concepts: tokens, context window, temperature, top-p
Major providers & playgrounds (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, open-source alternatives)
Identifying product/operational use-cases for AI
No-code demo: build a simple chat-driven workflow

handsOnProjects.title: AI-powered Daily Assistant
handsOnProjects.description: Design and configure a no-code assistant that summarizes, schedules, and ideates for a day’s work.

learningOutcomes: Recognize Generative AI capabilities and limits
Map AI use cases to business value
Build a basic no-code AI workflow

courses.title: Python for Generative AI Fast-Track
courses.description: Rapid hands-on Python primer targeted at OOP developers for GenAI projects.
lessons: Virtual environments, pip/poetry, notebooks
Basic Python for data I/O, JSON, YAML
HTTP APIs, async basics (httpx), SDK usage
Parsing & validating model outputs with Pydantic
Introduction to FastAPI and simple endpoint creation

handsOnProjects.title: Web Article Summarizer
handsOnProjects.description: A Python service that fetches a URL, extracts content, calls an LLM API, and returns a structured summary.

learningOutcomes: Be productive in Python for GenAI tasks
Integrate LLM APIs and validate structured outputs
Ship a simple API-backed GenAI microservice

courses.title: Prompt Engineering Fundamentals
courses.description: Fundamental patterns for reliable LLM behavior, prompt anatomy and debugging.
lessons: What is a prompt? System vs user prompts
Instruction design, role prompts, delimiters
Zero-shot, few-shot, in-context learning
Chain-of-Thought (CoT), ReAct, Reflexion patterns
Prompt debugging techniques and common pitfalls

handsOnProjects.title: Prompt Cookbook
handsOnProjects.description: Create a reusable library of 10 prompt templates for summarization, idea generation, classification and Q&A.

learningOutcomes: Design clear, reliable prompts for general tasks
Apply advanced prompting patterns for reasoning
Create a reusable prompt library

courses.title: Structured Outputs & Programmatic Prompting
courses.description: Techniques to force LLMs into structured, machine-parseable outputs and programmatic prompt orchestration.
lessons: Delimiters, JSON schemas, and output shaping
Pydantic validation and post-processing
Declarative prompting with DSPy & LMQL (concepts and examples)
Automating prompt-eval cycles

handsOnProjects.title: Market Research Extractor
handsOnProjects.description: Pipeline that converts free-form analyst notes into structured JSON market reports with validation.

learningOutcomes: Produce consistently structured API-ready responses
Automate prompt pipelines and validation
Integrate schema validation into production flows

courses.title: Domain Prompting Series (Choose one or more)
courses.description: Action-oriented specializations: adapt prompting techniques to business domains and content types.
lessons: Tone & format for social platforms (LinkedIn, X, Instagram)
Hooks, CTAs, and virality patterns
Iterative A/B prompt testing for campaigns

handsOnProjects.title: Market Content Generator
handsOnProjects.description: Auto-generate LinkedIn carousel posts + captions + schedule

learningOutcomes: Generate platform-tailored marketing content at scale

courses.title: RAG Foundations
courses.description: How to ground LLMs with retrieval — chunking, embeddings, and vector search basics.
lessons: Why RAG: hallucinations vs grounding
Embeddings: choice, dimensionality and providers
Chunking strategies and metadata practices
Intro to vector stores (FAISS, Chroma, Pinecone)

handsOnProjects.title: Company Handbook Q&A Assistant
handsOnProjects.description: Ingest company docs, build index, and serve a Q&A assistant with citations.

learningOutcomes: Choose chunking & embedding strategies for datasets
Build a basic RAG pipeline
Evaluate retrieval fidelity and citation quality

courses.title: Advanced RAG Pipelines & Evaluation
courses.description: Multi-vector/hybrid search, rerankers, multimodal RAG and evaluation techniques.
lessons: Hybrid search (BM25 + vectors) and weighted rerankers
SQL + semantic joins, structured sources
Multimodal RAG (images, tables, PDFs)
Evaluating groundedness (Ragas, TruLens) and building golden sets

handsOnProjects.title: E-commerce Knowledge Assistant
handsOnProjects.description: RAG over product manuals, reviews and FAQs with citations and reranking for best answers.

learningOutcomes: Implement hybrid retrieval strategies
Integrate multimodal sources into RAG
Run evaluation pipelines to measure faithfulness

courses.title: Building Your First AI Agent
courses.description: Designing simple agents with tool calls, planning and memory patterns.
lessons: Agent anatomy: Perception → Planning → Action → Feedback
Tool design & safe function calling
Short-term vs semantic memory
Simple planning loops and retries

handsOnProjects.title: Research & Email Agent
handsOnProjects.description: An agent that fetches articles, summarizes, and drafts an email reply or brief.

learningOutcomes: Design agent control loops
Implement secure tool calling and structured outputs
Add basic memory to improve agent performance

courses.title: Multi-Agent Systems & Collaboration
courses.description: Role specialization, negotiation, orchestration and multi-agent topologies.
lessons: Topologies: hub-and-spoke, marketplace, hierarchy, swarm
Role definition: Researcher, Planner, Executor, Reviewer
CrewAI, AutoGen and Swarm patterns (conceptual + demos)
Coordination, synchronization, and conflict resolution

handsOnProjects.title: Growth Squad Multi-Agent System
handsOnProjects.description: Researcher + Writer + Reviewer agents that collaborate to produce and validate weekly growth reports.

learningOutcomes: Design multi-agent workflows for real tasks
Implement inter-agent communication and role negotiation
Add review/quality-check layers to reduce hallucinations

courses.title: Safety, Observability & Guardrails for Agents
courses.description: Tracing, auditing, guardrails and policy enforcement for agentic systems.
lessons: Observability: traces, logs, and telemetry (LangSmith, Phoenix)
Guardrails: NeMo Guardrails, Llama Guard, policy gates
Audit trails and HITL checkpoints
Testing and stress scenarios for agents

handsOnProjects.title: Safe Research Assistant
handsOnProjects.description: An agent instrumented with audit logs, safety checks, and an approval flow.

learningOutcomes: Instrument agents for observability
Implement guardrails and policy enforcement
Design HITL workflows for critical operations

courses.title: Finetuning & Model Adaptation
courses.description: When to finetune vs use RAG, and how to adapt models efficiently.
lessons: Decision framework: finetune vs RAG vs prompting
Parameter-efficient finetuning (LoRA, Adapters)
Model merging and multi-task finetuning concepts
Handling memory and compute constraints

handsOnProjects.title: Domain Support Bot Finetuning
handsOnProjects.description: LoRA finetune a model on domain support tickets and measure improvements.

learningOutcomes: Decide when finetuning is beneficial
Run a PEFT finetuning workflow
Measure finetuning impact with evaluation harness

courses.title: Dataset Engineering & Synthetic Data
courses.description: Data curation, augmentation, deduplication, and synthetic data generation using LLMs.
lessons: Data quality metrics and coverage analysis
Annotation strategies and deduplication
Synthetic data generation with LLMs and filtering
Data pipelines for finetuning

handsOnProjects.title: Synthetic Training Dataset
handsOnProjects.description: Create and filter a synthetic dataset for a target domain and evaluate model improvements.

learningOutcomes: Produce high-quality training sets
Apply synthetic data effectively
Integrate dataset engineering into model workflows

courses.title: Inference Optimization & Serving
courses.description: Techniques to reduce latency and cost for serving LLMs and agent systems.
lessons: vLLM, TGI, Ray Serve architectures
Quantization, pruning and speculative decoding
Semantic caching and idempotency
Throughput, p95 latency planning and benchmarking

handsOnProjects.title: Optimize Assistant for Latency & Cost
handsOnProjects.description: Compare different serving options, add semantic cache and report on cost/latency trade-offs.

learningOutcomes: Choose serving architectures for scale
Apply quantization and caching strategies
Benchmark and optimize production systems

courses.title: AI System Architecture & Routing
courses.description: Design end-to-end AI pipelines covering routing, gateways, caching and model selection.
lessons: Model gateway & router patterns
Context management, session state and streaming
Traffic shaping: routing by cost, latency, capability
Security basics: key management and PII handling

handsOnProjects.title: Multi-Agent Helpdesk System
handsOnProjects.description: Deploy a routed system that selects models & tools based on request types, with streaming responses.

learningOutcomes: Architect scalable AI pipelines
Implement model routing & streaming
Integrate basic security and PII handling

courses.title: Monitoring, Guardrails & Feedback Loops
courses.description: Observability, feedback pipelines, A/B testing and governance for AI systems.
lessons: Tracing & metrics: LangSmith, Phoenix
Golden sets, online vs offline evals, CI for prompts
Human-in-the-loop (HITL) and approval flows
Policy governance, audit trails and compliance

handsOnProjects.title: Feedback & Eval Dashboard
handsOnProjects.description: Add feedback capture, evaluate with automated tests, and create an operational dashboard.

learningOutcomes: Set up evaluation pipelines and dashboards
Create HITL feedback loops and approval flows
Operationalize continuous improvement

courses.title: Building Agents with No-Code Tools (Flowise & Dify)
courses.description: Design business-ready agent flows without heavy code using visual builders.
lessons: No-code vs code-first tradeoffs
Flowise & Dify walkthroughs (building blocks, memory, variables)
Testing, sandboxing and exporting flows
Connecting to data sources (Google Drive, Notion, Sheets)

handsOnProjects.title: Flowise Research Automation Bot
handsOnProjects.description: End-to-end no-code bot to fetch docs, summarize and post to Slack/Notion.

learningOutcomes: Deliver production-ready no-code workflows
Integrate no-code flows with business apps
Maintain and iterate no-code automations

courses.title: Integrating Business Apps & Enterprise Automation
courses.description: Practical integration of agents and workflows with business systems and CRMs.
lessons: Connectors: Notion, Slack, Sheets, Airtable, Salesforce (concepts)
Automating leads, tickets, and team notifications
Security & access patterns for integrations
Measuring business impact and ROI

handsOnProjects.title: Lead Automation & Slack Integration
handsOnProjects.description: Capture leads, enrich via LLM, route to Slack & CRM with automated summaries.

learningOutcomes: Build integrations that automate core business processes
Measure and present business impact
Adopt enterprise-safe integration patterns

capstone.title: Capstone — Protocol-Aware Enterprise Agent
capstone.description: End-to-end project integrating RAG, multi-agent orchestration, guardrails, observability and both code & no-code delivery.
coreRequirements: RAG-backed knowledge base with citation & reranking
At least one multi-agent workflow (Researcher / Writer / Reviewer)
Deployment as an API + no-code flow (Flowise or Dify)
Business case writeup and ROI estimation
capstone.deliverable: Working system + technical writeup + 10-minute demo video + portfolio case study

programFeatures.liveWorkshops: Weekly live sessions for each module with hands-on walkthroughs and Q&A
programFeatures.labs: Guided labs using real APIs, toolkits and datasets
programFeatures.projects: 12+ portfolio projects across domains and techniques
programFeatures.mentorship: Community forums + periodic mentor office hours
programFeatures.updates: Quarterly content refreshes and live 'What's New' sessions
programFeatures.delivery: Materials provided as video + slides + notebooks + lab guides + project rubrics

enrollmentBenefits: Lifetime access to course materials and content updates for enrolled tracks
Exclusive live update sessions when major AI changes are included
Portfolio review and feedback for capstone and selected projects
Badges and shareable certificates on completion

termsAndLearningContinuityPolicy.headline: Terms & Learning Continuity Policy (Living Curriculum)
policy: Continuous Updates: The course content is a living curriculum. If new models, frameworks, libraries or significant platform changes emerge, we will update or replace affected modules so learners receive current, practical training.

Quarterly Review Cadence: Core modules will be reviewed at least quarterly. Minor updates (e.g., API examples) will be pushed as they arise. Major shifts in tooling or best-practice will be covered in dedicated update sessions.

Learner Access: Enrolled learners receive access to updated content for the tracks they are enrolled in. Major curriculum revisions will be accompanied by a live webinar that explains what changed and why.

Principle-First Teaching: While we teach practical tools and frameworks, our curriculum emphasizes enduring engineering principles (prompting logic, evaluation methodology, context engineering, observability, and governance). This ensures skills remain relevant despite tooling changes.

Replacement of Tools: If a better or more popular framework replaces an existing one in a given module, we will adopt the new framework in the live curriculum and provide migration notes and code examples for learners to map old patterns to new ones.
Expert Oversight: All updates are reviewed by our AI engineering faculty and validated against real-world applicability, security, and ethical considerations.
Ethics & Compliance: If new regulatory or ethical frameworks (for example region- or industry-specific guidance) become relevant, they will be integrated promptly into applicable modules.
Communication: Learners will be notified via email/portal of material changes, and a changelog with dates and a short description will be maintained.

Scope: The policy covers curriculum content, example implementations, and recommended tooling. It does not guarantee support for custom third-party integrations beyond the scope of provided labs, but we will provide guidance and migration patterns.
termsAndLearningContinuityPolicy.shortPromise: Tools will evolve. The curriculum will adapt. Your core skills will remain durable — and you’ll be kept up-to-date.
